<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WwRvWMRUhKE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
  
Around 1:00.  
Where have you seen KSP?

Last night I saw KSP mentioned in the comments in this video:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/InvF9e5kyjo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> Last night I saw KSP mentioned in the comments in this video:
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/InvF9e5kyjo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Nice! Now I want to build that.

ya i know i commented about that!

- - - Updated - - -

oh ya colin!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-12T21:52:35Z" title="08/12/2015 09:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 12, 2015</time> by carneyvich**

Yesterdays' Centauri Dreams quotes The Icarus Interstellar website, which mentioned KSP. So two for the price of one.

Starship Congress 2015 is being billed as an Ã¢â‚¬Ëœinterstellar hackathon,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ one centered on Ã¢â‚¬Å“hacking the paradigm of interstellar space exploration.Ã¢â‚¬Â The Icarus site notes that it occurs Ã¢â‚¬Å“With a nod to this yearÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s University setting and a Hollywood and video game-driven surge in popularity of deep space exploration (Ã¢â‚¬Å“InterstellarÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Guardians of the GalaxyÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“EVE: ValkyrieÃ¢â‚¬Â, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Kerbal Space Program 1.0Ã¢â‚¬Â)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦Ã¢â‚¬Â Talks and presentations will be punctuated by workshops and speakers from the deep space community over the two days of the event Ã¢â‚¬â€ the schedule is [here](http://www.icarusinterstellar.org/sc2015-announcement/), as is the registration link for accommodations at the Sheraton Philadelphia University City Hotel.

[http://www.icarusinterstellar.org/](http://www.icarusinterstellar.org/)

[http://www.centauri-dreams.org/](http://www.centauri-dreams.org/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-13T03:55:35Z" title="08/13/2015 03:55  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 13, 2015</time> by Aethon**

> Where have you seen KSP?

was doing some eh.. research.. on 4chan and came across a ksp thread. not going into detail here but most of the creations there were pretty offensive

also had a friend over who randomly started talking about 'this awesome game that he found on steam'.. i think you can guess which one that was ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> also had a friend over who randomly started talking about 'this awesome game that he found on steam'.. i think you can guess which one that was ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yeah, Barbie Dreamhouse Party is an excellent game.

I remember KSP being released on steam. It was still quite obscure then, but now you just need to look in the scientific areas of the internet to find it.

> 
> was doing some eh.. research.. on 4chan and came across a ksp thread. not going into detail here but most of the creations there were pretty offensive
> also had a friend over who randomly started talking about 'this awesome game that he found on steam'.. i think you can guess which one that was ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

You mean [Chicken Shot Gold?](http://store.steampowered.com/app/259340/)

> 
> Yeah, Barbie Dreamhouse Party is an excellent game.
> I remember KSP being released on steam. It was still quite obscure then, but now you just need to look in the scientific areas of the internet to find it.

For example, search for any IRL rocket in google images, and KSP will show up very quickly, higher up the more specific it is.

Kind of different from your guys, but a year or two a go, I had a supply teacher for physics and i saw KSP on his desktop.![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
Here I can only get a grand total of one person somewhat interested in KSP ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Go to [http://www.planetaryresources.com/#home-team](http://www.planetaryresources.com/#home-team) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

You can even mouse over that thumbnail...

Found a mention on xkcd what if section including a vid from Scott ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

[http://what-if.xkcd.com/139/](http://what-if.xkcd.com/139/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-14T13:48:32Z" title="08/14/2015 01:48  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 14, 2015</time> by Mantabloke**

Seeing this sign **in real life** made my day. I walked nearly an eighth of a mile grinning stupidly to get a closer look, as my puny potato cam had none of the resolution of my dual mount stereoscopic 576 megapixel biological optical sensors.

I was headed for an interview closeby and the company did hire me, after a month of unemployment mostly spent in KSP. I thus declare KSP a life changing experience.

![1NgZ6DW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1NgZ6DW.jpg)

![tGrTxmb.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/tGrTxmb.jpg)

In a German museum!

[http://zkm.de/en/event/2015/08/globale-global-games](http://zkm.de/en/event/2015/08/globale-global-games)
Uh Kasper I can't exactly see what's going on there.. Lemme guess, hey featured KSP?

Once I was searching Kerbal Space Program on Bing images, but autocorrect glitched and replaced "Kerbal" with "Purple." 

Guess what came up? A picture of Eve.

> 
> Go to [http://www.planetaryresources.com/#home-team](http://www.planetaryresources.com/#home-team) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> You can even mouse over that thumbnail...

I feel kind of bad for the guy that got photoshopped into that picture as a floating, disembodied head. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Kind of different from your guys, but a year or two a go, I had a supply teacher for physics and i saw KSP on his desktop.![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Nice!

> 
> Here I can only get a grand total of one person somewhat interested in KSP ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Sorry, keep on trying! That blank look they give you when you start to tell them...

> 
> Seeing this sign **in real life** made my day. I walked nearly an eighth of a mile grinning stupidly to get a closer look, as my puny potato cam had none of the resolution of my dual mount stereoscopic 576 megapixel biological optical sensors.
> I was headed for an interview closeby and the company did hire me, after a month of unemployment mostly spent in KSP. I thus declare KSP a life changing experience.
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/1NgZ6DW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1NgZ6DW.jpg)

What's the last letters?

> 
> What's the last letters?

Just one more letter.. it's Kerbau Rd, Rochor, Singapore.

Missed it by *that* much, as Maxwell Smart would say..
